Friday: Tech giants talk expansion, and two columnists sign off.
With a single scholarly article, Lina Khan, 29, has reframed decades of monopoly law.
Amazon says it will offer more than a million deals, including discounts on Echo devices, kitchen appliances and more — and extend the sale by an extra six hours compared with last year.
Betsy Gotbaum, a former New York City public advocate, writes of “the need for major campaign finance reform at the state level.” Also: The Amazon rain forest.
Readers view the president’s remarks as a threat to the free press and hypocritical.

The Seattle City Council repealed the tax in a 7-to-2 vote that was accompanied by acrimony and accusations. Less than a month ago, it had passed unanimously.
The Hollywood Reporter has created a two-year training program that aims to increase the number of movie and television executives of color.
